original_title: Sri Lanka plans law to punish candidates, media who violates election guidelines
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka plans to bring in a new law to take legal actions against candidates who violate a ‘code of conduct’ and news organization that go against ‘media guidelines’, Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.

The cabinet had given approval on December 12,2023 to amend the Provincial council, Local Authorities Election Ordinance and Referendum act to take legal action against news organizations that violate media guidelines after and election had been declared.
Instead of amending each law, a separate law called Election (special provision) act would be drafted.
The law will also facilitate special voting centers for selected voters that may not be able to vote from their specific registered areas.

In the cabinet meeting on December 12,20233ministers also gave the approval to bring in laws against the candidates who violate a ‘Code of Conduct’ during election times under the Parliament election act.

Meanwhile, the cabinet has also given the approval to present the amended Presidential Election act, Provincial council, Local Authorities Election Ordinance and Referendum act to the parliament as the Attorney General has approved the changes done after the passing of Election Expenditure Bill. (Colombo/ June 13/2023)
